title: Proposal: 1 year chat restriction.
body:
so hear me out.
for those toxic in the chat department of league of legends, a full year chat ban.
this will be only applied to those guilty of toxicity, flaming or anything related to chat that rewarded the punishment.

this (for toxic bois) will be after the 14 day ban, to let them reconcile in the ban period.
also, year as in REAL year, December 20 2018 - december 20 2019
a whole year of chat restriction.

**Why it works and why its fair:**

1: it allows toxic players to play the game, but not affect the community or less atleast.

2: it gives players A LONG time to think about their words, and if they still fuck up, they can't complain.

Why it dosen't work and why it could be broken:

1: players can still be toxic with a chat ban, just less.

2: inconsistency in the ban system.

leave your thoughts.

replies.body: Riot experimented with prolonged cbat punishments in the past, and found that players subjected to these extended punishments continued to find other ways to be toxic, many of which were harder to detect. They had such a vast amount of evidence supporting this trend that they discontinued the practice in favor of the sysyem we have now.

so is it riots official opinion that the chat system and the abuse we all face from toxic players, is a necessary evil to reduce the number of game impacting trolls in higher mmrs? Clearly if consistently toxic and previously banned players are forced to make new accounts new players will be placed with these toxic players and their enthusiasm for the game will be ruined the first time they come across some gold 4's 15th account chat abusing them in blind pick. Dont believe me? go make a smurf and see just how afraid of perma bans people are. People saying this isn't a problem are lying to themselves just because they think its a better punishment to perma ban the account's ability to play than it is to perma ban their ability to chat. someone thats going to troll in high elo isnt going to be dumb enough to chat abuse they simply start trolling when they get mad, everyone knows the system

You have to take Riots word for it. There is no public data.

I'm not personally a fan of duration punishments because they don't recognize reform.

the players I refer to have failed to show reform 4 times.
short-term punishments definitely aren't doing anything to the most toxic people.

I don't have a specific link handy, but it's something that they've reiterated several times since then. I last found it somewhere in Riot Tantram's history, I believe?

The problem, though, is not the chat. The problem is the players' attitude that taking anger out on strangers over a video game is acceptable.

Players with this sort of toxic attitude who are limited in chat for long periods of time (or permanently) will eventually turn to other methods of taking anger out. Maybe it's light griefing, such as not grouping. Maybe they "accidentally" take jungler's buffs more. Whatever it is, they resort to trolling that is not detectable by automated systems, and is hard to confirm as intentional even when a human reviews it.

This has been tried before and that was the result. Why would it be any different now?
has it? may I have a link?
Not going to happen, chat restricted players are a liability to their team, which is partly why they are also banned from ranked while restricted.

I'm not saying they should be allowed to play ranked? and from a Riot employee:

>a game can go along just fine without anyone using the chat.  pings and emotes suffice.

Rioter in question was probably Silver 3

Either way, if that was the general consensus, then A: it would still be wrong, and B: chat restrictions would be different.

Why give toxic players another chance.
It honestly boggles my mind how many people come on the forums with these "new" ideas when they are just the same,
regurgitated thought, posted over, and over again

So someone you play with tells you to kill yourself, wishes cancer on your family, wishes that the worst imaginable thing happens to your sister, and then ends the game with wishing you all your children are born with a birth defect.

You report him.

He gets punished with a 1 year chat restriction.

You start another game.

Same guys is in your team again, only he can't use chat.

you are talking about a very specific case here.
also, there are 10 game and 20 game chat bans.

the effect you are refering to can also happen in those situations.

No, it can not.
Because the case I presented is an extreme case of toxicity, in which case all chat restrictions are skipped and the person goes straight to a 2-week ban (or perma ban if they had a previous punishment before).
And someone this toxic likely had some prior punishment.
So in that case, as it is now, the person will get permabanned.
In the scenario you propose, even the most toxic person, even if they had a previous punishment, could be in my next game again.
Which I would not want to happen.

Hence no thank you to your proposal.
